title: Generating Global Polio Data

Collaborators outside CDC wish pull global polio data using sirfunctions package must access POLIS beforehand, well obtain POLIS API key. analysis conducted SIR team begin creating global polio dataset. CDC credentials, loading dataset can simple running: polio_data <- sirfunctions::get_all_polio_data() CDC employee, reach Stephanie Kovacs uvx4@cdc.gov ensure proper permissions set loading polio_data. guide tailored collaborators, may CDC credentials, access data POLIS.

title: Generating Global Polio Data
text: source several information POLIS, including case, environmental surveillance, immunization activity (SIA) data perform several data cleaning steps source, SIR team refers “preprocessing POLIS datasets.” tidypolis package required preprocessing. general, preprocessing involves following steps followed sequential order: Initialize preprocessing via tidypolis::init_tidypolis(). involves designating folder local machine store POLIS data. recommend creating folder called POLIS desktop. first time function ran, ask POLIS API key. Please ensure POLIS API key beforehand. Get POLIS tables via tidypolis::get_polis_data(). Run preprocessing pipeline via tidypolis::preprocess_data(type = "cdc"). type = "cdc" supported time. ensure comparable data produced SIR team, please use following schedule: Download POLIS tables (step 2): Tuesdays 6:00PM Eastern Time. Running preprocessing (step 3): Wednesdays 9:00AM Eastern Time.

title: Generating Global Polio Data
text: CDC creates district populations district population estimates uses variety patches data sources fill missingness. Data sources: - population estimates 2015, 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 2024 - additional patches received: 2018 Kenya patch, supplemental 2018 - 2022 population file, 2021/22 Pakistan population file CDC Pakistan team, Somalia 2022-2024 patch EMRO team - POLIS API population data Methods: 1. Use provided extracts create dataframe 2015 – 24 pops 2. patch missingness Pakistan Somalia patches 3. Determine Anchor Year identifying max year adm2GUID population number 3a. patch Kenya attach shapes – Kenyan pops aren’t assigned adm2GUIDs rather district name year use missing data. Note: attaching shapes key process population files need compatible global district shapes 4. Attach growth rates (growth rates can obtained contacting Stephanie Kovacs) fill using rate max year’s pop number 5. growth rate applied, determine districts missing pops join supplemental file 5a. Use growth rate apply districts missing data haven’t filled previous extracts patches. fills places either aren’t provided data extract provided data expired GUID shape changes years growth factor applied 6. Repeat steps 5 5a using POLIS population data API Assumptions/miscellaneous: - file assumed “golden record”. patching original methodology leaves district missing pop one patch files - Datasource types (population given year based growth factor applied records inherits datasource anchor year, also hierarchy data, 1. worldpop/, 2. Pakistan, Somalia Kenya Patches, 3. patch, 4. POLIS API)

title: The KPI Analysis Pipeline
text: Polio surveillance key performance indicators (KPIs) regularly monitored national programs, regional offices World Health Organization (), Surveillance Group (SG) Global Polio Eradication Initiative (GPEI). four main KPI tables: C1 - Certification Poliomyelitis Eradication C2 - AFP surveillance C3 - Environmental surveillance C4 - Laboratory surveillance KPI analysis pipeline focus creating tables, creating figures based tables, exporting results locally.

title: The KPI Analysis Pipeline
text: starting, create folder desktop called kpi_analysis. folder contain KPI runs. pipeline initiated using init_kpi() function. function takes three arguments: path: absolute path kpi_analysis folder. name: name KPI run. default, date init_kpi() ran. edav: whether analysis access resources EDAV . EDAV data science platform within CDC. non-CDC employees, please set FALSE.

title: The KPI Analysis Pipeline
text: Run following: init_kpi("path_to_kpi_folder") function set folder structure within kpi_analysis folder, well set paths export tables figures. KPI run folder, three subfolders: data, figures, tables. KPI template also created, contains code necessary run KPI analysis. function download global polio dataset lab data available. load polio lab data R environment. what: Helper function to read and write key data to the EDAV environment — edav_io
title: Helper function to read and write key data to the EDAV environment — edav_io
text: function serves primary way interact EDAV system R. can read, write, create folders, check whether file folder exists, upload files, list files folder.

title: Helper function to read and write key data to the EDAV environment — edav_io
code: edav_io(   io,   default_dir = "GID/PEB/SIR",   file_loc = NULL,   obj = NULL,   azcontainer = suppressMessages(get_azure_storage_connection()),   force_delete = F,   local_path = NULL,   ... )

title: Helper function to read and write key data to the EDAV environment — edav_io
text: io str type operation perform EDAV. "read" Read file EDAV, must rds, csv, rda, xls/xlsx file. "write" Write file EDAV, must rds, csv, rda, xls/xlsx file. write Excel file multiple sheets, pass named list containing tibbles interest. See examples. "exists.dir" Returns boolean checking see folder exists. "exists.file"Returns boolean checking see file exists. "create" Creates folder preceding folders. "list" Returns tibble objects folder. "upload" Moves file type EDAV. "delete" Deletes file. "delete.dir" Deletes folder. default_dir str default directory EDAV. "GID/PEB/SIR" default directory SIR data EDAV. Can set NULL provide full directory path file_loc. file_loc str Location "read", "write", "exists.dir", "exists.file", "create" "list", can include information default_dir set parameter NULL. obj robj Object saved, needed "write". Defaults NULL. azcontainer Azure container object returned get_azure_storage_connection(). force_delete logical Use delete io without verification command line. local_path str Local file pathway upload file EDAV. Default NULL. parameter required passing "upload" io parameter. ... Optional parameters work readr::read_delim() readxl::read_excel().

title: Helper function to read and write key data to the EDAV environment — edav_io
text: Output dependent argument passed io parameter.

title: Helper function to read and write key data to the EDAV environment — edav_io
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- edav_io("read", file_loc = "df1.csv") # read file from EDAV # Passing parameters that work with read_csv or read_excel, like sheet or skip. df2 <- edav_io("read", file_loc = "df2.xlsx", sheet = 1, skip = 2) list_of_df <- list(df_1 = df, df_2 = df) # Saves df to the test folder in EDAV edav_io("write", file_loc = "Data/test/df.csv", obj = df) # Saves list_of_df as an Excel file with multiple sheets. edav_io("write", file_loc = "Data/test/df.xlsx", obj = list_of_df) edav_io("exists.dir", "Data/nonexistentfolder") # returns FALSE edav_io("exists.file", file_loc = "Data/test/df1.csv") # returns TRUE edav_io("create", "Data/nonexistentfolder") # creates a folder called nonexistentfolder edav_io("list") # list all files from the default directory edav_io("upload", file_loc = "Data/test", local_path = "C:/Users/ABC1/Desktop/df2.csv") } # }

"es.vaccine.types" Default vaccine types. Used primarily generate_es_site_det(). "es.detections" Default detection types. Used primarily generate_es_site_det(). "vpd.critical.ctry": Priority VPD countries "vpd.binary.ctry": Priority non-priority VPD countries binary designation. "vpd.colors": VPD colors.

what: Create adhoc maps for emergences — generate_adhoc_map
title: Create adhoc maps for emergences — generate_adhoc_map
text: Creates map recent emergences. default display outbreaks past 13 months.

title: Create adhoc maps for emergences — generate_adhoc_map
code: generate_adhoc_map(   raw.data,   country,   virus_type = "cVDPV 2",   vdpv = T,   new_detect = T,   surv = c("AFP", "ES", "OTHER"),   labels = "YES",   owner = "CDC-GID-PEB",   new_detect_expand = F,   start_date = NULL,   end_date = NULL,   emg_cols = NULL,   output = NULL,   image_size = NULL,   height = 6.2,   width = 4.5,   scale = 1.25,   dpi = 300 )

title: Create adhoc maps for emergences — generate_adhoc_map
text: raw.data list Global polio data. output get_all_polio_data(). Make sure spatial data attached, otherwise, work. country str list Country name list country names. virus_type str list. Virus type include. Valid values : "cVDPV 1", "cVDPV 2", "cVDPV 3", "WILD 1". Can pass list. vdpv logical Whether include VPDV maps. Default TRUE. new_detect logical Whether highlight new detections based HQ report date. Default TRUE. surv str list Surveillance options. Valid values : "AFP", "ES", "" "" includes Case Contact, Community, Healthy Children Sampling. Can pass list. labels str Include labels regions virus detections. Options: "": regions "YES": Recent Detections - <13 months owner str produced map. Defaults "CDC-GID-PEB". new_detect_expand logical Whether expand reporting window. Defaults FALSE. start_date str Start date. specified, defaults 13 months prior download date raw.data. end_date str End date. specified, defaults download date raw.data. emg_cols list named list emergence colors. Defaults NULL, download using set_emergence_colors(). output str Either path local folder save map , "sharepoint", NULL. Defaults NULL. image_size str Standard sizes map outputs. Options : "full_slide" "soco_slide" "half_slide" Defaults NULL. height numeric Height map. Defaults 6.2. width numeric Width map. Defaults 4.5. scale numeric Scale map. Defaults 1.25. dpi numeric DPI map. Defaults 300.

title: Create adhoc maps for emergences — generate_adhoc_map
text: ggplot map outbreaks.

title: Create adhoc maps for emergences — generate_adhoc_map
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ raw.data <- get_all_polio_data() p1 <- generate_adhoc_map(raw.data, "algeria") # Put colors in emergences that don't have a mapped color emg_cols <- set_emergence_colors(raw.data, c("nigeria", "chad")) emg_cols["NIE-BOS-1"] <- "yellow" emg_cols["NIE-YBS-1"] <- "green" p2 <- generate_adhoc_map(raw.data, c("nigeria", "chad"), emg_cols = emg_cols) } # }

title: Generate incidence map timeline — generate_incidence_map
text: pos_data tibble Positives dataset. ctry_sf ctry_sf Global country shapefile. emergence_group str emergence group vector emergence group names. emergence_colors list named list emergence group mapped color. Names correspond emergence group, values colors. colors passed, colors randomly selected emergence group. sources str Source detection vector source names. Valid values : "AFP", "Community", "Contact", "ENV", "Healthy", "iVDPV". start_date str Start date map. default, earliest date detection. end_date str End date map. default, latest detection. monthly_rolling_window int Monthly rolling window show. Defaults 12. output_dir str Local path directory output figure. Defaults NULL, export figure. fps int Frames per second. increase speed GIF, increase fps. default, set 2. drop_legend logical Drop legends figure . drop_ctry_labels logical Drop country labels map. drop_description logical Drop case counts map caption. pt_size int Size points map. Defaults 5.

title: Generate a summary table for sample timeliness intervals — generate_int_data

what: Generate stool adequacy columns in the AFP dataset — generate_stool_data
title: Generate stool adequacy columns in the AFP dataset — generate_stool_data
text: function adds adequacy final column called adequacy.final adequacy.final2 AFP linelist. function borrows part f.stool.ad.01(), adequacy final column generated can match stool adequacy function treats bad missing data classify adequacy final column. adequacy.final contains original classification sample adequacy.final2 contains final classification according missing bad data treated.

title: Generate stool adequacy columns in the AFP dataset — generate_stool_data
text: afp.data tibble AFP linelist. Either ctry.data$afp..2 start_date str Start date analysis. end_date str End date analysis. missing str treat missing data. Valid values : "good", "bad", "remove". Defaults "good". calculating adequacy.final column: "good" uses adequacy.03 "bad" uses adequacy.01 "exclude" uses adequacy.02 bad.data str  treat bad data. Valid values :"remove", "inadequate". Defaults "inadequate". "inadequate" treats samples bad data inadequate.

text: ctry.data list Large list containing polio data country. ctry.extract tibble Country NPAFP rate. Output f.npafp.rate.01() calculated country level. dist.extract tibble District NPAFP rate. Output f.npafp.rate.01() calculated district level. cstool tibble Country stool adequacy. Output f.stool.ad.01() calculated country level. dstool tibble District stool adequacy. text: flextable Table summarizing yearly trends NPAFP stool adequacy national level.

title: Surveillance indicator table — generate_surv_ind_tab
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ctry.data <- init_dr("algeria") ctry.extract <- f.npafp.rate.01(   afp.data = ctry.data$afp.all.2,   pop.data = ctry.data$ctry.pop,   start.date = start_date,   end.date = end_date,   spatial.scale = "ctry",   pending = T,   rolling = F,   sp_continuity_validation = F ) dist.extract <- f.npafp.rate.01(   afp.data = ctry.data$afp.all.2,   pop.data = ctry.data$ctry.pop,   start.date = start_date,   end.date = end_date,   spatial.scale = "dist",   pending = T,   rolling = F,   sp_continuity_validation = F ) cstool <- f.stool.ad.01(   afp.data = ctry.data$afp.all.2,   admin.data = ctry.data$ctry.pop,   start.date = start_date,   end.date = end_date,   spatial.scale = "ctry",   missing = "good",   bad.data = "inadequate",   rolling = F,   sp_continuity_validation = F ) dstool <- f.stool.ad.01(   afp.data = ctry.data$afp.all.2,   admin.data = ctry.data$dist.pop,   start.date = start_date,   end.date = end_date,   spatial.scale = "dist",   missing = "good",   bad.data = "inadequate",   rolling = F,   sp_continuity_validation = F ) afp.by.month <- generate_afp_by_month(ctry.data$afp.all.2, "2021-01-01", "2023-12-31") afp.case <- generate_afp_by_month_summary(afp.by.month, ctry.data, start_date, end_date, "year") generate_surv_ind_tab(ctry.data, ctry.extract, dist.extract, cstool, dstool, afp.case) } # }

what: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
title: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
text: Computes region-level time series surveillance indicators aggregating across countries present inputs (implicitly joins). function: builds district-level indicators, restricts districts U15 ≥ 100,000, derives % population adequate districts (NPAFP rate ≥ 2 stool adequacy ≥ 80%), counts adequate vs. total ≥100k districts, aggregates country-level indicators region using simple means rates sums AFP cases, returns either tidy tibble formatted flextable.

title: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
code: generate_surv_reg_tab(   ctry_data,   ctry.extract,   dist.extract,   cstool,   dstool,   afp.cases,   start_year = NULL,   end_year = NULL,   output = c("flextable", "tibble") )

title: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
text: ctry_data list-like object contains least dist.pop, data frame district metadata. Must include columns: ctry (country code/name), adm2guid (district id), preferably year U15 population column (e.g., u15pop). ctry.extract Country-level dataset (one row per country-year). contain year either adm0guid (join cstool) ctry. include npafp_rate per.stool.ad, columns can unambiguously renamed . dist.extract District-level dataset (one row per district-year) minimum adm2guid year. already contains u15pop, npafp_rate, per.stool.ad, used; otherwise may pulled via joins. cstool Country-level surveillance stool adequacy dataset year either adm0guid ctry, containing npafp_rate per.stool.ad (columns can renamed ). dstool District-level surveillance stool adequacy dataset adm2guid, year, indicator columns npafp_rate, per.stool.ad. afp.cases Either: country-year AFP case data columns ctry, year, cases column (e.g., afp.cases, afp.case, cases) region/overall year totals year cases column. function rename first matching cases column afp.cases. start_year, end_year Optional numeric bounds filter analysis years, inclusive. output One "flextable" (default) "tibble". "tibble", returns data frame columns: year, afp.cases, npafp_rate, per.stool.ad, prop.dist.adeq, prop.

title: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
text: flextable (default) presentation, tibble output = "tibble".

title: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
text: U15 population column detection: function tries ensure column named u15pop exists joined district data : coalescing u15pop.x/u15pop.y joins, renaming common aliases (e.g., u15_pop, U15Pop, under15_pop), importing ctry_data$dist.pop adm2guid year. Adequacy rule (district level): Adequate npafp_rate >= 2 per.stool.ad >= 80. % population adequate ≥100k districts : \(100 * (sum(U15 adequate ≥100k districts) / sum(U15 ≥100k districts))\). *Aggregation*: AFP cases: summed across countries per year. npafp_rate per.stool.ad: simple means across countries per year (switch weighted mean needed). output flextable renders year plain text (thousands separator).

title: Regional Surveillance Indicators by Year (Multi-country aggregate) — generate_surv_reg_tab
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ ft <- generate_surv_reg_tab(   ctry_data    = ctry_data,   ctry.extract = ctry.extract,   dist.extract = dist.extract,   cstool       = cstool,   dstool       = dstool,   afp.cases    = afp.cases,   start_year   = 2021,   end_year     = 2024,   output       = "flextable" ) } # }

title: Retrieve all pre-processed polio data — get_all_polio_data
code: get_all_polio_data(   size = "small",   data_folder = "GID/PEB/SIR/Data",   polis_folder = "GID/PEB/SIR/POLIS",   core_ready_folder = "Core_Ready_Files",   force.new.run = FALSE,   recreate.static.files = FALSE,   attach.spatial.data = TRUE,   use_edav = TRUE,   use_archived_data = FALSE,   archive = TRUE,   keep_n_archives = Inf,   output_format = "rds",   local_caching = TRUE )

title: Retrieve all pre-processed polio data — get_all_polio_data
text: size str Size data download. Defaults "small". "small": Data 2019-present. "medium": Data 2016-present. "large": Data 2001-present. data_folder str Location data folder containing pre-processed POLIS data, spatial files, coverage data, population data. Defaults "GID/PEB/SIR/Data". polis_folder str Location POLIS folder. Defaults "GID/PEB/SIR/POLIS". core_ready_folder str core ready folder use. Defaults "Core_Ready_Files". force.new.run logical Default FALSE, TRUE run recent data cache. recreate.static.files logical Default FALSE, TRUE run data cache. attach.spatial.data logical Default TRUE, adds spatial data downloaded object. use_edav logical Build raw data list using EDAV files. Defaults TRUE. use_archived_data logical Allows ability recreate raw data file using previous preprocessed data. archive Logical. Whether archive previous output directories overwriting. Default TRUE. keep_n_archives Numeric. Number archive folders retain. Defaults Inf, keeps archives. Set finite number (e.g., 3) automatically delete older archives beyond N recent. output_format str: output_format save files . Available formats include 'rds' 'qs2'. Defaults 'rds'. local_caching logical Enable local caching data stored locally downloaded updated data EDAV.

what: sirfunctions: Key Functions to Analyze Global Polio Surveillance Data — sirfunctions-package
title: sirfunctions: Key Functions to Analyze Global Polio Surveillance Data — sirfunctions-package
text: sirfunctions package contains key functions used Surveillance, Innovation, Research (SIR) team within Polio Eradication Branch (PEB) Centers Disease Control Prevention (CDC). includes functions download cleaned global polio data World Health Organization () Polio Information System (POLIS) geographic files. addition, package contains functions visualize important epidemiological trends perform key performance indicators NPAFP rates, EV rates, stool adequacy. Apart getting data calculating key indicators, several functions also facilitate communication, visualize trends, perform data quality checks.

title: sirfunctions: Key Functions to Analyze Global Polio Surveillance Data — sirfunctions-package
text: Maintainer: Nishant Kishore ynm2@cdc.gov (ORCID) Authors: Mervin Keith Cuadera xrg9@cdc.gov (ORCID) Nicholas Heaghney uic3@cdc.gov Elizabeth Krow-Lucal yxn9@cdc.gov Smita Chavan wsy2@cdc.gov

title: sirfunctions i/o handler — sirfunctions_io
text: Manages read/write/list/create/delete functions sirfunctions. function adapted tidypolis_io.

title: sirfunctions i/o handler — sirfunctions_io
code: sirfunctions_io(   io,   default_folder = "GID/PEB/SIR",   file_loc,   obj = NULL,   edav = TRUE,   azcontainer = suppressMessages(sirfunctions::get_azure_storage_connection()),   full_names = T,   ... )

title: sirfunctions i/o handler — sirfunctions_io
text: io str type operation use. Valid values include: "read": reads data specified file_path. "write": writes data specified file_path. "list": lists files specified file_path. "exists.dir": determines whether directory present. "exists.file": determines whether file present. "create.dir": creates directory specified file_path. "delete": deletes file specified file_path. "delete.dir": deletes folder specified file_path. default_folder str default folder use. Defaults "GID/PEB/SIR. file_loc str Path file relative default_folder. obj str Object loaded EDAV edav logical Whether function interact EDAV environment. Defaults TRUE, otherwise, interacts files locally. azcontainer Azure container container object returned get_azure_storage_connection(). full_names logical io="list", include full reference path. Default TRUE. ... Optional parameters work readr::read_delim() readxl::read_excel().

title: sirfunctions i/o handler — sirfunctions_io
text: Conditional io. io "read", return tibble. io "list", return list file names. Otherwise, function return NULL. exists.dir exists.file return logical.

title: sirfunctions i/o handler — sirfunctions_io
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ df <- sirfunctions_io("read", file_loc = "df1.csv") # read file from EDAV # Passing parameters that work with read_csv or read_excel, like sheet or skip. df2 <- sirfunctions_io("read", file_loc = "df2.xlsx", sheet = 1, skip = 2) list_of_df <- list(df_1 = df, df_2 = df) # Saves df to the test folder in EDAV sirfunctions_io("write", file_loc = "Data/test/df.csv", obj = df) # Saves list_of_df as an Excel file with multiple sheets. sirfunctions_io("write", file_loc = "Data/test/df.xlsx", obj = list_of_df) sirfunctions_io("exists.dir", "Data/nonexistentfolder") # returns FALSE sirfunctions_io("exists.file", file_loc = "Data/test/df1.csv") # returns TRUE sirfunctions_io("create", "Data/nonexistentfolder") # creates a folder called nonexistentfolder sirfunctions_io("list") # list all files from the default directory } # }

what: Extract vaccine coverage information from IHME estimates — update_vacc_cov_data
title: Extract vaccine coverage information from IHME estimates — update_vacc_cov_data
text: Function extract IHME vaccine coverage data existing spatial files. Key spatial data can found . Please keep mind sources may change. Reach IHME directly information. Enter email gain access data folder. Inside data folder go Geospatial Vaccine Coverage > 04_Rasters. Download following geotifs place single folder local machine: bcg1_cov_mean_raked_2000_<current year>.tif dpt1_cov_mean_raked_2000_<current year>.tif dpt3_cov_mean_raked_2000_<current year>.tif mcv1_cov_mean_raked_2000_<current year>.tif polio3_cov_mean_raked_2000_<current year>.tif NOTE: <current year> change vaccine coverage data gets updated.
